trigger_event: While reviewing system failures over late-night drinks, Oksana Lintz confides in Alex about finding secret BCI audit logs and Halden’s coded diary pages, which reveal proof of forced disappearances.
dilemma: Oksana must choose whether to leak the explosive evidence to the city, risking chaos but forcing the truth into the open, or to instead trigger Halden’s lullaby protocol, which would guide districts through an orderly restoration, withholding the most damning evidence and giving people a structured choice for the future.
reason: Oksana hesitates because leaking the truth could dismantle trust overnight and send the city into turmoil, but orchestrating a gradual, guided recovery could protect stability—though it may also conceal necessary reckoning and let abusers slip away unpunished.
choice_a: Publicly release the hidden BCI logs and Halden’s diary pages, exposing the forced disappearances and demanding collective accountability.
belief_a: Only full exposure can heal the city’s wounds.
Without truth, reforms will always feel hollow.
Justice must not be protected by secrecy, even if chaos follows.
choice_b: Activate Halden’s lullaby—a gradual, citywide audio code that helps neighborhoods unlock system power, guiding a managed but incomplete reckoning.
belief_b: A city on edge can be led to renewal if change comes in steps.
Hope requires giving people agency without overwhelming them.
Sudden shocks could break community bonds that slow healing.
